generation.name: Generation Z
generation.description: Digital natives who have never known a world without the internet and social media.

definingEvents.details: Platforms like Facebook (2004), Twitter (2006), Instagram (2010), Snapchat (2011), and TikTok (2016) revolutionized how people communicate, consume content, and form communities.
The global financial crisis, triggered by the U.S. housing bubble collapse, led to massive unemployment and economic instability worldwide.
Notable incidents like the Columbine High School shooting (1999), Sandy Hook (2012), and Parkland (2018) brought national attention to gun violence in schools.
The COVID-19 pandemic disrupted education, jobs, and social interactions, forcing schools and workplaces to shift online.
Advancements in artificial intelligence, automation, and robotics have begun transforming the job market, education, and everyday life.
